overview_of_class:
CPAs are required to conduct research when performing tax, accounting, and auditing services. The successful accountant will not only be able to access and utilize online databases but also concisely convey their findings to clients and third parties using proper grammar and punctuation. This course introduces the type of research the professional will encounter in their practice and covers the available research databases and steps to conduct such research. Also covered are communication techniques, grammar, and punctuation.

This course is conducted completely online. A technology fee will be added to tuition.

This course will have optional online office hours on Monday evenings from 6:15 - 9:15 pm

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
The goals of this course are to:
- Identify the sources of authoritative accounting and tax literature and pronouncements.
- Analyze accounting and tax issues using authoritative accounting and tax literature and pronouncements.
- Integrate findings of accounting and tax research into a concise, coherent, and grammatically correct
document to support your position.
- Prepare accounting documents, commonly used in practice, with an emphasis on clarity and correct
grammar.
- Compose written communication tasks found on the CPA Exam.
- Apply teambuilding, interpersonal, and presentation skills in a team setting.
